summary: This document is an email chain from October 19, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing logistical challenges in meeting a discovery deadline for the Epstein/Maxwell case. The emails focus on making copies of documents, coordinating between paralegals and the FBI, and setting internal review deadlines ahead of a formal production date.

events.title: Internal SDNY Email Chain on Discovery Logistics
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel exchange emails discussing the logistical challenges of making copies for discovery in the Epstein/Maxwell case, including the unavailability of a CART analyst and the need to coordinate with paralegals and the FBI.

events.title: Internal Review Deadline for Epstein/Maxwell Discovery
events.description: The prosecution team sets an internal deadline of October 31, 2020, for reviewers to finish their work, ahead of the formal discovery production deadline, to allow time for review of responsiveness coding and copying.

events.title: Formal Discovery Production Deadline
events.description: The formal deadline for producing discovery in the Epstein/Maxwell case is noted as November 9, 2020.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal prosecution team stress and logistical hurdles in meeting a discovery deadline for the Epstein/Maxwell case in October 2020.
A CART analyst specifically assigned to the Epstein/Maxwell case was out of the office, creating a bottleneck for making necessary copies.
The team had set an internal review completion deadline of October 31, 2020, to ensure they could meet the formal November 9, 2020, production deadline.
Initial plans for paralegals or the FBI to make copies failed, requiring another office resource (likely an IT or support staff member) to complete the task.
